comments.body: Maybe this should return `Future<int>` and we should change the calls to exit to just return the value.
Will that properly set the exit code of the dart execution?
I believe so, but we can try to see.  (Certainly not a big deal either way.)
This is sort of lame.  Can we not write this information into the file when we first create it?

I agree. I started by modifying the flx building routine to accept a header argument, but it then needed to go all the way to ZipBuilder and its two implementations, for a use that's very specific to Fuchsia. That seemed equally silly. Happy to make the change though, your call.
Can you add a comment to wherever else this list exists that cross-references this copy?  Even better, can we share the code so we don't need to keep these two lists in sync?
The lists aren't the same (Fuchsia is a subset of the main executable).  Added note.

consider importing it as `import 'dart:io' as io hide File, FileSystemEntity;` ?

Or maybe have a base/io.dart file that imports dart:io, and the file system and process packages, and re-exports the supported APIs?

The idea being to stop people accidentally depending on the APIs we don't want to use directly any more.
ack.  Will do this in a separate change.
I really would prefer dropping the use of zones here in favour of explicitly passing in a "context" variable of some sort, but that's a story for another day.
